issue.title: dynamic respond_to in ResourceController

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
this is a fix for #3539

befor this change, AA respond to html, xml and json on each action, that's a securty problem while the user can view a record as xml and see the raw data.

after this change AA respond only to html on each action and respond to xml, csv, json only it the format is configured for the download links.

Now a user can only see that data he has access to

body:
@timoschilling sounds great to me and looks exactly as I expected this was working, but I've not a deep understanding of AA to review it.
Thank you @timoschilling

issue.title: Hiding download_links does not stop users dowloading

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body: If I hide the download links, a user can still add .json, .csv, etc. to the URL and download the files. How can I limit certain user to just .html format?

body:
I don't know if this issue is still active but i found that constraining the format in a `constraints` block to just html when mounting activeadmin invalidates the `xml` and `json` routes.

``` ruby
constraints :format => :html do
  ActiveAdmin.routes(self)
end
```

I don't see this as a serious security issue, since Active Admin is meant for true administrators of your website to use (people who already have your trust). While it is a security issue for certain uses of Active Admin, fixing it isn't a priority.

However that doesn't mean a PR wouldn't be accepted.
@seanlinsley I'm with you but we should leave this open

hi - I am looking for this exact solution: just hiding the download links does not work, I need to be able to un-authorize a user if their role does not allow to actually download CSVs, etc. Could this be merged soon?

issue.title: restrict access if format was disabled with download_links

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.title: When upgrading to current master, the JSON request for GET no longer works for admin resources

repository.name: activeadmin
repository.description: The administration framework for Ruby on Rails applications.

issue.body:
### Expected behavior

What do you think should happen?

Rails 4.2, Active Admin 1.0 @ Master, June 1st. (Rev. adcc7e379d1a3f2fab478f0b5c4d11af1bf488ea)

When making a request to http://myresource.com/admin/titles the application shows you the titles in html and index view for titles. Once upgraded to master, it no longer works with a route as http://myresource.com/admin/titles.json (with an authenticated admin user) to return a json list of titles. 

In migration docs, I was unable to find this change.  

### Actual behavior

What actually happens?

 It presents as "Unauthorized".  

### How to reproduce

Create a new rails app and set up activeadmin.  Migrate at least one field and create the admin interface.  Browse to the index view and then add .json to the route.
